FuzzyRule¶

class FuzzyRule(rule_text: str)¶

Bases: object

Fuzzy rule used to comprise rulesets in fuzzy inference systems.

Rules can be constructed with natural language using the names of membership function groups and functions.

Parameters

rule_text – A rule as a string.

antecedents¶

List of rule antecedents.

Type

List[_Antecedent]

consequent¶

Rule consequent.

Type

_Consequent

Example

>>> rule = FuzzyRule("if temperature is cold then heater is on")

Methods

evaluate(x, groupset)

Evaluates the rule given valid input values and compatible groupset.
evaluate(x: typing.Mapping[str, <sphinx.util.inspect.TypeAliasForwardRef object at 0x000001A7A8602A60>], groupset: hotfis.membership.fuzzygroupset.FuzzyGroupset) → Tuple[str, str, <sphinx.util.inspect.TypeAliasForwardRef object at 0x000001A7A8543D90>]¶

Evaluates the rule given valid input values and compatible groupset.

The inputs can be dictionaries or similar data structures where the keys are membership function group names (ex. ‘temperature’) and the values are either a float or iterable of floats representing values.

Parameters

  • x – Input values as dictionary with groups as keys and a scalar or array-like as values. Also supports other data structures accessible by group name.

  • groupset – Groupset of membership functions required for evaluation.

Returns

Tuple with output group name, function name, and value.
